A Letter From Our Waters

Our Mission

No Creature Left
on Dry Land

Founded by Gil Fontaine — a 3-inch comet goldfish with a 9-pound vision — The Deep End Foundation operates the ocean's only registered nonprofit pawn brokerage. We believe every seahorse, shrimp, and visiting land tourist deserves a fair appraisal at 40 fathoms.

Fair Appraisals Below Sea Level

Our certified tidal appraisers evaluate your items using the Fontaine Scale™ — a proprietary system Gil developed after a panic attack in a kelp forest. Every barnacle-encrusted watch. Every waterlogged saxophone. Appraised with dignity.

Doorbell Desensitization Program

87% of underwater shop owners report crippling doorbell anxiety. Our 12-week program — developed by Gil himself after he fainted during a Groupon rush — has helped 340+ proprietors answer their doors without hyperventilating.

The Confidence Current Initiative

Gil's legendary self-assurance is not a gift — it's a practice. Through our free workshops ("You Are Not Your Bowl"), we teach goldfish and other small-bodied aquatics to project authority in a world that expects them to be decorative.

Volunteer Opportunities

Dive In With Us

We need hands. Fins. Tentacles. Whatever you've got.

I

Appraisal Buddy

Stand next to Gil while he appraises items. Your only job is to nod reassuringly. Tuesdays and Thursdays, 2–4 PM. Gil says he doesn't need this. His therapist disagrees.

II

Doorbell Response Team

When the doorbell rings, you answer it first and report back: "It's just a customer, Gil. A normal customer." Must be comfortable with moderate to severe fish trembling. CPR-certified preferred.

III

Land Object Translator

Humans keep pawning "phones" and "laptops." We need someone who can explain what these are without making Gil feel inadequate. Last translator made a comment about memory and Gil didn't come in for a week.

IV

Coral Reef PR Intern

Help us maintain our 4.2-star Yelp rating. We lost a full star after Gil panic-appraised a lobster's shell while the lobster was still wearing it. Unpaid but you get to keep one unclaimed harmonica per month.

Frequently Asked Questions

We Get Asked These
More Than You'd Think

Is Gil actually a goldfish? +
Yes. Comet variety, 3.1 inches, orange with one white spot he calls his "business mark." He has a registered EIN and everything. The IRS tried to audit him in 2022 but couldn't figure out the underwater mailing address.
Why does the doorbell cause him anxiety? +
In 2019, a sea bass rang the doorbell 47 times as a prank. Gil was alone. He describes it as "the day the sound won." He's made incredible progress — he can now hear a doorbell on television without leaving the room.
How are items appraised underwater? +
The Fontaine Scale™ evaluates three criteria: buoyancy (does it float away during appraisal), corrosion potential (will it last the 30-day hold period), and emotional resonance (does Gil feel a connection to it). The third criterion accounts for 80% of the final valuation.
Can I pawn something that's already wet? +
Everything is already wet. That's the whole point. Gil wrote a 40-page manifesto about this called "Moisture Is Not a Defect" that we distribute to all new customers. It's mostly good.
Is the $47.99 donation amount a typo? +
No. Gil insists that round numbers are "a land construct designed to create false comfort." He wanted $47.93 but the payment processor wouldn't allow it. He compromised but he's not happy about it.
